meanings.sent1: She finalised her drawing by adding the last details.
meanings.sent2: The students finalised their project before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: After hours of hard work, she finalised her puzzle and felt accomplished.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner finalised the race with a sprint to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The chef finalised the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.

meanings.definition: To make a decision or agreement official.
meanings.sent1: The judge finalised the verdict after careful consideration.
meanings.sent2: The company finalised the contract with a signature.
meanings.sent3: The friends finalised their movie choice with a game of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: The referee finalised the call, much to the disappointment of the losing team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher finalised the seating arrangement for the class trip.

meanings.definition: To bring something to an end.
meanings.sent1: The magician finalised his performance with a grand finale.
meanings.sent2: The meeting was finalised with a round of applause.
meanings.sent3: The party finalised with a surprise guest appearance.
meanings.sent4: The story finalised with a plot twist that left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent5: The concert finalised with a spectacular fireworks display.
